title: Vault Plunderer
subtitle: An escape game in VR where you have to get out of a cave

content.text:
Vault Plunderer is a virtual reality escape game developed on Unreal Engine 4.

In the game, you play as a tomb raider who accidentally falls to the bottom of a cave.

The player then discovers mysterious gloves that allow them to manipulate the gigantic mechanisms around them.

Each glove is equipped with several charges used to activate or move mechanisms from a distance.

The player must then reconstruct energy circuits to open the final door.

This project was created as part of my Master's degree and had two major constraints. It had to be a VR escape game and take place in a 3 x 3 meter play area.

To work around the second constraint, we ensured that the player could interact with elements outside of the 3 x 3 platform they move on.

This is why we implemented the glove manipulation mechanic.

content.alt: Manipulating a cylinder at a distance

content.text:
As a Game Designer, I contributed to defining the core mechanics. However, I mainly spent time designing several of the game's puzzles.

There are a total of seven conceptualized puzzles, five of which are in the game. I primarily worked on puzzle 5, the cylinder puzzle.

The goal of this puzzle is to reconstruct a circuit to bring energy from one side of the room to the other.

The puzzle consists of three cylinders, each covered in circuit segments. Each segment has connectors of different shapes.

Energy is only transmitted from one segment to another if connectors of the same shape are adjacent.
The goal is to manipulate the cylinders to align the circuit segments, knowing that the smaller inner cylinder can slide under the outer cylinders and move from one side to the other.

In this project, I was also tasked with completely reworking Puzzle 3, which involves retrieving one of the two gloves.

The puzzle was initially designed with rail systems that needed to be rotated to reconstruct a path to the platform.

Due to time constraints, the original idea had to be scrapped, and I was assigned to rethink the puzzle.

In its new version, the puzzle keeps the same principle. The player needs to recreate a path of rails to bring the glove back to the platform.

The path is made up of fixed rails with gaps in certain places. The player has pieces of rails that are used to fill in these gaps to complete a continuous path.

The player must carefully observe the shape of the rails to place the right pieces in the correct spots.
